Posts.Title: July 2011 rads Merilee jankc

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2011 04:17PM julianna51 wrote: Take your trip, enjoy and relax.   Whatever your results are, you are not going to be doing anything regarding surgery or treatment within those two weeks and it will probably be really good for you to get away on a family trip.    Big hugs to you, warm wishes and prayers.   Right now, there are so many unknowns to you and that is one of the hardest things... the waiting and not knowing.
Posts.Title: Help, am scared about making wrong decision CaroleH CaroleH

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2011 03:37AM julianna51 wrote: I was diagnosed with DCIS similar to yours on April 25th and wanted to wait until late June to have my surgery.  My BS told me he didn't think I should wait that long so my surgery was on May 24th.   So, even though I had a trip planned that I really really wanted to go on, I went ahead with the earlier surgery date.    I had some microinvasion - I don't know if it would have grown more had I waited.    I just would never want to look back and say "I should have...." Only you know what you're comfortable with.
Posts.Title: AM I REALLY THAT STUPID?? NEED LOTS OF ADVICE! rn4babies rn4babies

Posts.Content: May 22, 2011 11:10PM julianna51 wrote: My surgeon told me no mammos or ultrasound.  Just said I would see him annually for 5 years for an examination.

Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2011 11:26PM julianna51 wrote: NmbrLcky13 - Thinking of you and sending you positive thoughts.   I don't know if you've told your children anything yet...but I understand how hard that can be for you.   I was so worried to tell my two daughters (30 and 28) but they were amazing.   Stronger than I ever thought they could be and they were my champions at my surgery.   I know that they are scared for me...for themselves but they are amazing young women - I am sure your children are amazing young adults also and they will be your champions too.   Hang in there, this is the hardest part, waiting on biopsy results. Blessings to you, Juls
